roboRallyPackage.gameElementClasses

Interface IEnergyHolder

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Battery, RepairKit, Robot

    public interface IEnergyHolder
    The gameElement-classes who implement this interface will have an internal energy level.
    Version:
    24 may 2012
    Author:
    Jonas Schouterden (r0260385) & Nele Rober (r0262954) Bachelor Ingenieurswetenschappen, KULeuven

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean canAcceptForRecharge(double amount)
      Checks whether the given amount of energy, expressed in watt-seconds [Ws], can be added to the current energy level of this IEnergyHolder.
      boolean canHaveAsEnergy(double energy)
      Checks whether the given amount of energy, expressed in Watt-second [Ws], is a valid amount of energy for this IEnergyHolder.
      boolean canHaveAsMaxEnergy(double maxEnergy)
      Checks whether the given maximum energy level, expressed in watt-second [Ws], is a valid maximum energy level for this IEnergyHolder.
      double getEnergy(EnergyUnit unit)
      Returns the variable representing the current amount if energy of this IEnergyHolder in the given energy unit.
      double getEnergyFraction()
      Returns a percentage of the current energy level relative to the maximum amount of energy this IEnergyHolder can have.
      double getMaxEnergy()
      Returns the variable representing the maximum amount of energy this IEnergyHolder can have, expressed in watt-seconds [Ws].
      boolean isTerminated() 
      void recharge(double amount)
      Recharges this IEnergyHolder with the given amount of energy, expressed in watt-seconds [Ws].
      void setEnergy(double energyAmount)
      Sets the amount of energy of this IEnergyHolder to the given amount of energy, expressed in watt-seconds [Ws].
      void setMaxEnergy(double maxEnergyAmount)
      Sets the maximum energy level of this IEnergyHolder to the given maximum energy level, expressed in watt-seconds [Ws].
      void transferEnergy(IEnergyHolder other, double amount)
      Transfers the given amount of energy, expressed in watt-seconds [Ws], from this IEnergyHolder to another IEnergyHolder.

    • Method Detail

      • isTerminated

        boolean isTerminated()

      • getEnergy

        double getEnergy(EnergyUnit unit)
        Returns the variable representing the current amount if energy of this IEnergyHolder in the given energy unit.
        Parameters:
        unit - The energy unit in which the returned energy amount will be expressed.

      • setEnergy

        void setEnergy(double energyAmount)
               throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Sets the amount of energy of this IEnergyHolder to the given amount of energy, expressed in watt-seconds [Ws].
        Parameters:
        energyAmount - The new energy amount for this IEnergyHolder in watt-seconds [Ws].
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - ... | this.isTerminated()

      • canHaveAsEnergy

        boolean canHaveAsEnergy(double energy)
        Checks whether the given amount of energy, expressed in Watt-second [Ws], is a valid amount of energy for this IEnergyHolder.
        Parameters:
        energy - The amount of energy to be checked, expressed in Watt-second.
        Returns:
        False if the given energy is greater than or equal to the maximal amount of energy an IEnergyHolder can have. | result != (energy > this.getMaxEnergy())

      • getMaxEnergy

        double getMaxEnergy()
        Returns the variable representing the maximum amount of energy this IEnergyHolder can have, expressed in watt-seconds [Ws].

      • setMaxEnergy

        void setMaxEnergy(double maxEnergyAmount)
                  throws java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                         java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
        Sets the maximum energy level of this IEnergyHolder to the given maximum energy level, expressed in watt-seconds [Ws].
        Parameters:
        maxEnergyAmount - The new maximum energy level for this IEnergyHolder in watt-seconds [Ws].
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - When this IEnergyHolder is terminated. | this.isTerminated()
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - When the maximum energy level of this IEnergeHolder cannot be altered. | ! (this instance of Robot)

      • canHaveAsMaxEnergy

        boolean canHaveAsMaxEnergy(double maxEnergy)
        Checks whether the given maximum energy level, expressed in watt-second [Ws], is a valid maximum energy level for this IEnergyHolder.
        Parameters:
        maxEnergy - The maximum energy level to be checked, expressed in watt-second [Ws].
        Returns:
        False if the given energy isn't a valid energy amount | result == EnergyAmount.isValidEnergyAmount(maxEnergy)

      • getEnergyFraction

        double getEnergyFraction()
        Returns a percentage of the current energy level relative to the maximum amount of energy this IEnergyHolder can have.
        Returns:
        A percentage of the current energy level relative to the maximum amount of energy this IEnergyHolder can have. | result == (this.getEnergy(EnergyUnit.WATTSECOND)) / this.getMaxEnergy()) * 100

      • recharge

        void recharge(double amount)
              throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Recharges this IEnergyHolder with the given amount of energy, expressed in watt-seconds [Ws].
        Parameters:
        amount - The amount of energy to be added to this IEnergyHolder, expressed in watt-seconds [Ws].
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - When this IEnergyHolder is terminated. | this.isTerminated()

      • canAcceptForRecharge

        boolean canAcceptForRecharge(double amount)
        Checks whether the given amount of energy, expressed in watt-seconds [Ws], can be added to the current energy level of this IEnergyHolder.
        Parameters:
        amount - The amount to be checked, expressed in watt-seconds [Ws].
        Returns:
        False if this IEnergyHolder cannot have a total energy level equal to the given amount of energy added to its current energy level. | result == (this.canHaveAsEnergy(this.getEnergy(EnergyUnit.WATTSECOND) + amount))

      • transferEnergy

        void transferEnergy(IEnergyHolder other,
                  double amount)
                    throws java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                           java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
        Transfers the given amount of energy, expressed in watt-seconds [Ws], from this IEnergyHolder to another IEnergyHolder.
        Parameters:
        other - The IEnergyHolder to be given energy.
        amount - The amount of energy to be transferred, expressed in watt-second [Ws].
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - When this IEnergyHolder or the other IEnergyHolder is terminated | this.isTerminated() || other.isTerminated()
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - When this IEnergyHolder cannot transfer energy to another IEnergyHolder | ! this instanceof Battery
